text: Wilton Brad Watson (July 24, 1955July 8, 2020) was an American author and academic. He was a professor at the University of Wyoming until his death. Watson published four books, two novels and two collections of short stories. He was born in Meridian, Mississippi. Watson's 2002 novel The Heaven of Mercury was a finalist for the National Book Award. In 2013, Watson received the Award in Letters from The American Academy of Arts and Letters. Watson died on July 8, 2020, at his home in Laramie, Wyoming from heart failure, aged 64. ==References== Category:Writers from Mississippi Category:American novelists Category:Writers from Wyoming Category:1955 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Educators from Wyoming Category:Educators from Mississippi Category:People from Meridian, Mississippi
